hasDeepProp.name: hasDeepProp
hasDeepProp.summary: Check if an array or an object has the given property.

makeStoragePath.name: makeStoragePath

cleanStoragePath.name: cleanStoragePath

mergeObjects.name: mergeObjects
mergeObjects.summary: Returns to a merged object from two objects.

flatten.name: flatten

mergeArrays.name: mergeArrays
mergeArrays.summary: Returns to a merged array from two or more arrays.

toObject.name: toObject
toObject.summary: Converts a JSON string or an array into an object.

toArray.name: toArray
toArray.summary: Converts a JSON string or an object into an array.

jsObject.name: jsObject

indentJson.name: indentJson
indentJson.summary: Indents a flat JSON string to make it human-readable.

removeEmpty.name: removeEmpty
removeEmpty.summary: Returns an object or an array cleaned of all empty values.

arguments.name: arr
arguments.description: space If "true" the spaces are removed, default: "false".

toGroups.name: toGroups
toGroups.summary: Converts an indexed array into a numeric array where the original index is a property.

isAssoc.name: isAssoc
isAssoc.summary: Checks if the given array is associative.

getDump.name: getDump
getDump.summary: Returns a dump of the given variable.

getHdump.name: getHdump
getHdump.summary: Returns an HTML dump of the given variable.

hdump.name: hdump
hdump.summary: Dumps the given variable in HTML.

adump.name: adump
adump.summary: Adaptative dump, i.e. dunps in text if CLI, HTML otherwise.

buildOptions.name: buildOptions
buildOptions.summary: Returns the HTML code for creating the <option> tag(s) based on an array.

description_parts.content: If the array is indexed, the index will be used as value *

arguments.name: selected
arguments.description: label A label for empty value

toKeypair.name: toKeypair
toKeypair.summary: Converts a numeric array into an associative one, alternating key and value.

arguments.name: arr
arguments.description: If false no index protection will be performed

maxWithKey.name: maxWithKey
maxWithKey.summary: Returns the maximum value of a given property from a 2 dimensions array.

arguments.name: ar
arguments.description: Where to check the property value from

minWithKey.name: minWithKey
minWithKey.summary: Returns the minimum value of an index from a multidimensional array.

debug.name: debug
debug.summary: Gets the backtrace and dumps or logs it into a file.

map.name: map
map.summary: Applies the given function at all levels of a multidimensional array (if defined param $item).

arguments.name: fn
arguments.description: The function to be applied to the items of the array

arguments.name: items
arguments.description: If null the function will be applied just to the item of the parent array

rmap.name: rmap
rmap.summary: Applies the given function at all levels of a multidimensional array after picking the items (if defined param $item).

arguments.name: fn
arguments.description: The function to be applied to the items of the array

arguments.name: items
arguments.description: If null the function will be applied just to the item of the parent array

find.name: find
find.summary: Returns the array's first index, which satisfies the 'where' condition.

filter.name: filter

sum.name: sum

getRow.name: getRow
getRow.summary: Returns the first row of an array to satisfy the where parameters ({@link find()).

getField.name: getField
getField.summary: Returns the first value of a specific field of an array.

arguments.name: where
arguments.description: The field where to look for

pick.name: pick
pick.summary: Returns a reference to a subarray targeted by an array $keys.

sort.name: sort
sort.summary: Sorts the items of an array.

sortBy.name: sortBy
sortBy.summary: Sorts the items of an indexed array based on a given $key.

isWindows.name: isWindows
isWindows.summary: Checks if the operating system, from which PHP is executed, is Windows or not.

curl.name: curl
curl.summary: Makes a Curl call towards a URL and returns the result as a string.

lastCurlError.name: lastCurlError

lastCurlCode.name: lastCurlCode

lastCurlInfo.name: lastCurlInfo

getTree.name: getTree
getTree.summary: Returns the given array or object as a tree structure ready for a JS tree.

makeTree.name: makeTree
makeTree.summary: Returns a view of an array or object as a JS tree.
makeTree.description:
*
```php
X::dump(X::makeTree([['id' => 1,'name' => 'Andrew','fname' => 'Williams','children' =>[['name' => 'Emma','age' => 6],['name' => 'Giorgio','age' => 9]]], ['id' => 2,'name' => 'Albert','fname' => 'Taylor','children' =>[['name' => 'Esther','age' => 6],['name' => 'Paul','age' => 9]]], ['id' => 3,'name' => 'Mike','fname' => 'Smith','children' =>[['name' => 'Sara','age' => 6],['name' => 'Fred','age' => 9]]]]));
/* string
   0
     id: 1
     name: Andrew
     fname: Williams
     children:
       0
         name: Emma
         age: 6
       1
         name: Giorgio
         age: 9
   1
     id: 2
     name: Albert
     fname: Taylor
     children
       0
         name: Esther
         age: 6
       1
         name: Paul
         age: 9
   2
     id: 3
     name: Mike
     fname: Smith
     children
     0
       name: Sara
       age: 6
     1
       name: Fred
       age: 9
```

description_parts.content:
X::dump(X::makeTree([['id' => 1,'name' => 'Andrew','fname' => 'Williams','children' =>[['name' => 'Emma','age' => 6],['name' => 'Giorgio','age' => 9]]], ['id' => 2,'name' => 'Albert','fname' => 'Taylor','children' =>[['name' => 'Esther','age' => 6],['name' => 'Paul','age' => 9]]], ['id' => 3,'name' => 'Mike','fname' => 'Smith','children' =>[['name' => 'Sara','age' => 6],['name' => 'Fred','age' => 9]]]]));
/* string
   0
     id: 1
     name: Andrew
     fname: Williams
     children:
       0
         name: Emma
         age: 6
       1
         name: Giorgio
         age: 9
   1
     id: 2
     name: Albert
     fname: Taylor
     children
       0
         name: Esther
         age: 6
       1
         name: Paul
         age: 9
   2
     id: 3
     name: Mike
     fname: Smith
     children
     0
       name: Sara
       age: 6
     1
       name: Fred
       age: 9

arguments.name: binary
arguments.description: Set it to true if you want hypens to seperate the UID

convertUids.name: convertUids
convertUids.summary: Converts a hex UID to a binary UID. You can also give an array or an object to convert the array's items or the object's properties.

compareFloats.name: compareFloats
compareFloats.summary: Compares two float numbers with the given operator.

fixJson.name: fixJson

jsonBase64Encode.name: jsonBase64Encode
jsonBase64Encode.summary: Encodes an array's values to the base64 encoding scheme. You can also convert the resulting array into a JSON string (default).

jsonBase64Decode.name: jsonBase64Decode
jsonBase64Decode.summary: Decodes the base64 array's values. You can also give a JSON string of an array.
